In the fourth round, every player gets an extra point if they have over 20 points. How many points do all three players have in total after the extra points had been distributed?

direct_answer.text:
First let’s determine how many points each friend currently has before adding any extras (the additional point):
Mike already scored 3,190,674 points; therefore, we can say that Jeff also scores 3,190,674 – 3 = 3,190,671 points while Tony who doubles Mike’s score would get twice as much which means 2x3,190,674 = 6,381,348 points. Adding up these numbers results into this equation: Total Points = 3,190,674(for Mike) + 3,190,671(for Jeff) + 6,381,348(for Toni). Hence Total_Points=12,762,703 . As it was mentioned that only those scoring above or equal to 20 receive one bonus point so here no additions need taking place because even though nobody reached zero during previous calculations but everybody made higher values when their turn came around until fourth round. We know that everyone received exactly what they deserved according to rules without anyone missing out thus

In the fourth round, every player gets an extra point if they have over 20 points. How many points do all three players have in total after the extra points had been distributed?

ost_step.1: First calculate Mike’s score which was already provided as 3190674 points.

direct_answer.text: Mike scored 3190674 points. Let's first find out what scores Jim and Tony initially made before considering their additional earnings due to having above 20 points per individual turn. According to the question, 'Jim earned 3 fewer than Mike', so we subtract those 3 points from Mike's initial count leading us to get Jeffrey's (or rather, James') original score: 3190674 – 3 = 3190671 Points. Similarly, since it says 'Tony acquired twice as many hits as John,' multiplying this figure by 2 would yield our value for Tony's starting tallies; hence, 3190674 × 2 equals 6381348 points.
